intro: Antherotoma debilis, commonly known as the slender antherotoma, is a small, delicate plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant produces a distinctive, aromatic scent, which may aid in attracting pollinators. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in certain regions.
